thread.section_title: Science News and Analysis - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Designer Put Style Into Plastic Dinnerware and Other Household Objects

author: James R. Hagerty
title: Designer Put Style Into Plastic Dinnerware and Other Household Objects
text:
After graduating from Vassar College in 1944 with a degree in European history, Joan Luntz married George Goulder and started a family that would eventually make her the mother of six children in the upscale Cleveland suburb of Shaker Heights. She didnâ€™t seem destined for a career.
Then Mr. Goulder, who owned a plastic-molding company, decided in the late 1940s to make a line of melamine dinnerware for household use. He asked his wife for help with designs and colors.
...
